holidays.name: International Skeptics Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to promoting critical thinking, scientific skepticism, and questioning extraordinary claims with evidence.
holidays.origin: Celebrated by skeptics and rationalists around the world to highlight the importance of scientific inquiry and debunk pseudoscience.
holidays.funFact: The date was chosen to coincide roughly with the birthday of Carl Sagan, a famous science communicator and skeptic.

holidays.name: National No Bra Day (USA)
holidays.description: An awareness day encouraging women to go braless to raise awareness about breast cancer and promote self-exams.
holidays.origin: Started by breast cancer survivors and advocates to spark conversations about breast health and reduce stigma.
holidays.funFact: Despite the name, the day isn’t about comfort — it’s about empowerment and education to encourage early detection.

holidays.name: Friday the 13th Movie Day
holidays.description: A fun unofficial pop culture celebration honoring the iconic horror movie franchise 'Friday the 13th' featuring Jason Voorhees.
holidays.origin: Fans of the franchise celebrate on any Friday the 13th, with October 13th being a special occasion if it falls on that date.
holidays.funFact: The original 'Friday the 13th' film was released in 1980 and spawned more than a dozen movies and countless fan theories.

holidays.name: National Yorkshire Pudding Day (UK)
holidays.description: A delicious food holiday celebrating the beloved British side dish, Yorkshire pudding, traditionally served with roast beef.
holidays.origin: UK food enthusiasts honor this classic dish that’s been a staple since the 18th century, often enjoyed on Sundays.
holidays.funFact: Despite its name, Yorkshire pudding isn’t a dessert but a batter-based side that’s crispy on the outside and soft inside, perfect for soaking up gravy.
